ygData.subject: Re: Binding in CB
ygData.msgSnippet: I would list a few exceptions, depending on your class of course. I mean, if you re a gnome, you don t want to be bound in SF all the time-- what a
ygData.messageBody:
I would list a few exceptions, depending on your
class of course. I mean, if you're a gnome, you don't
want to be bound in SF all the time-- what a
pain!!!<br><br>Generally, though, you're right for any elves. BUT- If
you're a caster, it's a lot easier to bind in DC if
you're staying in Unrest for any amount of time. It's a
pain to run back there all the way from GFay if you
die. <br><br>Also, Bind just outside the MM zone in
Lfay if you're taking on MM. Death is common in both
Unrest and MM, so it just makes it easier to be close at
hand-- your group will appreciate not haveing to wait
for you--haha<br><br>BONUS-- all classes can be bound
ANYWHERE in Gfay. So for melee types, get a bind at the
zone boundry to BB if you're in Unrest (i think it's a
closer run than Kaladim), zone boundry to Lfay if you're
going to MM, or the zone boundry to CB if you'll be in
CB. There are always high level casters at the Wizzie
spires who can bind you there, or maybe walk over to the
zone with you.<br><br>Xela<br><br>P.S.-- Unless you do
something outrageous as the controlled of a Yahoo club, you
will generally not be liable for anything that happens
to people who avail themselves of the message
boards. To protect yourself further, though, you could
put a disclaimer in the Club discription. People have
to be responsible for their own actions-- i'd take
that case, in CA at least.
